Welcome to Kepler Planet Distribution Function’s documentation!¶

Contents:

posterior Module¶

class posterior.Posterior(candidates, systems, lower_left=None, upper_right=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class representing a posterior object for the selection-effects model of the observed Kepler planet number density in the period-radius plane.

alpha(p, ms, rs, snr0s)[source]¶

Returns the average probability over the planetary period-radius distribution of detecting a planet (transit probability times detection probability) about stars with the given masses, radii, and SNRs.

background_density(p, ps, rs)[source]¶

Return the background density at the given points in the period-radius plane.

covariance_matrix(p, inv=False)[source]¶

Returns the covariance matrix (or inverse, if inv=True) corresponding to the parameters p.

draw(p0, ids, masses, radii, snr0s)[source]¶

Draw planets and background “detections” around the stars with the given masses, radii, and SNRs as described by the model parameters p0.

draw_background(p, N)[source]¶

Draw N systems from the background distribution specified by parameters p.

dtype[source]¶

Gives the numpy datatype of the parameters.

foreground_density(p, ps, rs)[source]¶

Returns the true foreground density for the given parameters and planet periods and radii (in years and Earth radii, respectively).

gaussian_selection_integral(mu, sigma, xmin, xmax)[source]¶

Evaluates

\[\int_{x_\mathrm{min}}^{x_\mathrm{max}} dx\, \phi(x) \frac{x-x_\mathrm{min}}{x_\mathrm{max}-x_\mathrm{min}} + \int_{x_\mathrm{max}}^\infty dx \, \phi(x)\]
gradient(p)[source]¶

Returns a numerical approximation to the gradient of the posterior at the point p.

log_snr(ps, rs, snr0s)[source]¶

Returns the log of the SNR for the given periods and radii around stars with the given SNR0s.

nparams[source]¶

The number of parameters.

pdetect(p, ps, rs, snr0s)[source]¶

Returns the detection probability assuming that a planet transits given parameters p, periods ps, planetary radii rs, and stellar SNRs snr0s.

pnames[source]¶

Gives LaTeX names for the parameters.

ptransit(ps, ms, rs)[source]¶

Returns the probability of a transit at the given periods around stars of the given masses and radii.

to_params(p)[source]¶

Converts the array p to a named-array representing parameters.

transit_selection_factor[source]¶

Probability of transit in a 1yr orbit about the sun.

plots Module¶

plots.eta_earths(logpost, chain)[source]¶

Returns an array of \(\eta_\oplus\) computed at each parameter sample in the given chain.

\(\eta_\oplus\) is defined as

\[\eta_\oplus \equiv \left. \frac{d N}{d (\ln R) \, d (\ln P)} \right|_{P = 1 \mathrm{ yr}, R = 1 R_\oplus}\]

where \(N\) is the number of planets per star.

plots.plot_error_ellipse(logpost, p)[source]¶

Plots the location of the mean and the 1-sigma error ellipse in the P-R plane for the given params.

plots.plot_error_ellipse_and_bounds(logpost, p)[source]¶

Plots the location of the mean, the 1-sigma error ellipse and the background distribution bounds in the P-R plane for the given params.

plots.plot_true_foreground_density(logpost, p)[source]¶

Plots the true (un-selected) foreground density in the P-R plane at the indicated parameters.
